conclusion: Trace the path of the liquid from each starting point (A, B, and C) through the baffles to the bottom containers.
Liquid from A will first hit the cyan baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
Liquid will flow downwards and to the right, hitting the orange baffle.
Orange baffle is angled downwards to the left.
Orange baffle directs the liquid towards the left.
Liquid will hit the brown baffle, which is angled downwards to the right.
Brown baffle directs the liquid towards the right.
Liquid will flow into the leftmost container, which is container D.
Liquid from B will first hit the black baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid will flow downwards and to the left, hitting the yellow baffle.
Yellow baffle is angled downwards to the right.
Yellow baffle directs the liquid towards the right.
Liquid will hit the white baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
White baffle directs the liquid towards the left.
Liquid will flow into the second container from the left, which is container D.
Liquid from C will first hit the green baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid will flow downwards and to the left, hitting the red baffle.
Red baffle is angled downwards to the right.
Red baffle directs the liquid towards the right.
Liquid will hit the yellow baffle, which is angled downwards to the left.
Yellow baffle directs the liquid towards the left.
Liquid will flow into the rightmost container, which is container E.
Liquid from A will flow into container D.
Liquid from B will flow into container D.
